intro: Setaria breviglumis, commonly known as slender dropseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Setaria breviglumis is adapted to thrive in full sun and is considered a valuable component of native plant communities.
